Patent Information.Patent Title: Anti-microbial Peptides And Methods Of Use Thereof
Patent Information.Abstract: Anti-microbial peptides and methods of use are provided.

Sequence Information.Family: Belongs to the class IIb bacteriocin
Sequence Information.Target Organism: Gram-positive bacteria:Pediococcus pentosaceus Pac 1.0 (MIC=50 nM), Lactobacillus plantarum 965 (MIC=0.1 nM), L. sake NCDO 2714 (MIC=50 nM), Leptostylus viridescens NCDO 1655 (MIC=5 nM). [PlnJ:PlnK=1:1]
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: No cytotoxicity information found in the reference(s) presented
Sequence Information.Structure Description: In DPC micelles, PlnJ has an N-terminal amphiphilic alpha-helix between Trp-3 and Tyr-15. Crucial residues: Gly-13 in PlnJ is very sensitive, giving more than a 100-fold reduction in activity when large residues replace glycine. Gly-20 in PlnJ was replaced, the activity was reduced less than 10-fold.

Literature.Title: Antagonistic activity of Lactobacillus plantarum C11 two new two-peptide bacteriocins, plantaricins EF and JK, and the induction factor plantaricin A.
Literature.Author: Anderssen EL, Diep DB, Nes IF, Eijsink VG, Nissen-Meyer J.

Literature.Title: Three-dimensional structure of the two-peptide bacteriocin plantaricin JK.
Literature.Author: Rogne P, Haugen C, Fimland G, Nissen-Meyer J, Kristiansen PE.
